column1: Minangkabau International Airport (Indonesian: Bandar Udara Internasional Minangkabau
column2: Minangkabau: Bandar Udaro Internasional Minangkabau) (IATA: PDG
column3: ICAO: WIPT) is the principal airport serving the province of West Sumatra on the island of Sumatra
column4: Indonesia. It is located about 27 km north-west of Padang
column6: Padang Pariaman regency. The airport became operational in July 2005
column7: replacing the old Tabing Airport in Padang. The airport is named after the Minangkabau ethnic group who inhabit the region. There is one terminal building for both international flights and domestic flights. The airport has 17 check-in counters
column9: and 9 ticket sales counters. The architecture of airport terminal adopting bagonjong (spired roof)
column10: Minangkabau vernacular architecture commonly found in rumah gadang traditional house.
